instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 Fanspin, no post
threads.message:
All voltages present, clock chip replaced, no light on USB mouse. Even tried different BIOS, but nothing changed. No liquid damage, it just stopped working.
Dead CPU the only possibility?

threads.title: 820-00165 Fanspin, no post
threads.message:
All voltages present ont he MLB, even VCORE?
Pin 3 of U1950 steady high?

threads.title: 820-00165 Fanspin, no post
threads.message: Yes, all of them are present.

threads.title: 820-00165 Fanspin, no post
threads.message:
None of USB ports works?
Try MLB without LIO flex connected; no trackpad, nor other perypheral.
PLT_RESET_L goes high?

threads.title: 820-00165 Fanspin, no post
threads.message:
Nope, non of the USB ports work. This was tested without anything connected.
PLT_RESET_L = 3.3v.

threads.title: 820-00165 Fanspin, no post
threads.message:
Check if PLT_RST_BUF_L is high too.
Also check if you get correct voltage on all the L/C blocks near CPU (PCH corner).
